name: Struts1: Validate() Method of Struts Validator form must call super.validate()
Ensure that Struts Forms extend a Validator Class
Ensure to have the validation activated  for all Struts action mappings
Ensure to validate each field of a form
Ensure that unsecured EJB remote method are not used as they lead to security weakness
Ensure that Struts 2 Action Fields without Validation are not used as they lead to security weakness
Ensure all defined validation forms are used
Ensure not having hard-coded network resources names in the source files (JEE)
Ensure you don't have hard-coded credentials in your source code because it could be retro-engineered by attackers.
Ensure you don't hard-code password in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (Javascript)
Ensure to keep enabled the Strict Contextual Escaping to make code secure by default and for easy auditing for vulnerabilities
Make sure you do not allow 'Javascript' and 'http' as accepted protocols to avoid Cross-site-scripting
Ensure activating Content-Security-Policy HTTP header to avoid untrusted source
Ensure disabling X-Powered-By header in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to prevent specifically-targeted attacks on running applications
Ensure setting the X-Frame-Options in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to avoid Clickjacking attacks
Ensure setting up the No Cache headers in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to avoid catching bad information.
Ensure setting the Strict-Transport-Security HTTP header to secure and encrypt communications to the Node.js server
Ensure enabling NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED attributes allowing rejecting self signed certificates
Ensure you have enable SSL verification in node-curl
Ensure you don't hard-code password in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (Typescript)
Ensure disabling X-Powered-By header in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to prevent specifically-targeted attacks on running applications
Ensure setting the X-Frame-Options in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to avoid Clickjacking attacks
Ensure setting up the No Cache headers in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to avoid catching bad information.
Ensure setting the Strict-Transport-Security HTTP header to secure and encrypt communications to the Node.js server
Ensure activating Content-Security-Policy HTTP header to avoid untrusted source
Ensure you have enable SSL verification in node-curl
Ensure enabling NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED attributes allowing rejecting self signed certificates
Always Revert After Impersonation
Ensure you don't compare passwords against hard-coded strings in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (C#)
Avoid calling CoSetProxyBlanket and CoInitializeSecurity
Ensure that you are not using predictable SecureRandom Seeds
Ensure safely set X-Frame-Option  to avoid Clickjacking attack
Ensure securing Shutdown Actuator Endpoint from unauthenticated access.
Ensure explicitly specifying single HTTP method in @RequestMapping methods to avoid information leakage
Ensure not using the same name for multiple validation forms to avoid any validation error.
Ensure you have setup the X-Frame-Options in HTTP Response (ASP.NET)
Ensure you did not keep the tracing activated in your ASPX file to not expose sensitive information for the hackers
Ensure you did not keep the tracing activated in your web config file to not expose sensitive information for the hackers
Ensure the impersonation flag remains set to false (ASP.NET)
Ensure you have reviewed the source code file and disable the tracing property
Ensure you don't mention "*" use specific domain
Ensure you set the EnableHeaderChecking flag to true in the configuration file
Ensure to limit users access only to authorized resources (.NET)
Ensure you trust the source of your metadata by enabling HttpsGetEnalbled and HttpsGetUrl in code
Ensure you trust the source of your metadata by enabling HttpsGetEnalbled and HttpsGetUrl in configuration
Avoid disabling custom errors mode to prevent exposure of exceptions and error data
Avoid debug binaries that include detailed debug information
